definition: hair/drawing brush/(in the) least/one thousandth/currency unit, 0.1 yuan
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve

sentences.english: When it was light enough Johnsy mercilessly commanded that the shade be raised.
sentences.chinese: 天剛亮，瓊西毫不留情地命令把窗簾拉起來。

sentences.english: Digital designers will go so far as to unsympathetically say the same about analog-IC designers.
sentences.chinese: 數字設計師們也毫不留情地批評模擬集成電路設計師。

sentences.english: Unsentimentally, she threw out her dead son's toys.
sentences.chinese: 她毫不留情地把自己死去孩子的玩具全部扔掉了。

sentences.english: Bitch racoon dog is bitten again chase after again, ruthless.
sentences.chinese: 母狐貍就又咬又追，毫不留情。

sentences.english: The online war over Gaza was relentless.
sentences.chinese: 整個加沙地帶的網站戰爭同樣毫不留情。

sentences.english: Last time he showed you no mercy.
sentences.chinese: 上次他對你絲毫不留情。

sentences.english: This cook just happened to be rather ignorant, so he did not mind being cruel when he had the upper hand.
sentences.chinese: 這個廚師恰好無知愚魯，在佔上風時，手下毫不留情。

sentences.english: She ripped off the mask of the hypocrite mercilessly.
sentences.chinese: 她毫不留情地剝掉這個僞君子的畫皮。

sentences.english: Fastidiously, she drinks the liquid tissues of her prey. Then she moves on, to kill again.
sentences.chinese: 它毫不留情的吸取獵物的體液，然後繼續殺死它。

sentences.english: I hear people who have sold blood to face relentless chatter.
sentences.chinese: 一聽到病友曾經賣過血，毫不留情面的進行數落。

sentences.english: The two animals fought, relentlessly tearing at each other’s flesh.
sentences.chinese: 兩隻動物撕殺起來，彼此毫不留情地撕咬着對方的肉。

sentences.english: I heard that that teacher was unmerciful to the students on the exam.
sentences.chinese: 我聽說那個老師對參加考試的學生毫不留情。

sentences.english: Qaddafi declared he would show “no mercy” to his own people.
sentences.chinese: 卡扎菲宣佈，他對他的人民將“毫不留情”。

sentences.english: New York was inexorable in its condemnation of business irregularities.
sentences.chinese: 紐約社會對生意場中不軌行爲的譴責是毫不留情的。

sentences.english: Be listened by Wang An Shi, nowise show consideration of give her head a record.
sentences.chinese: 被王安石聽到了，毫不留情的就給了她腦袋一記。

definition: to relent (to spare sb's feelings)/to show mercy or forgiveness/to forbear/lenient
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
lit. splitting the head and covering the face (idiom); fig. pelting (with rain etc)/showering down
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to not mind (at all, a bit)/to not care in the slightest
